titles.title: Nägär bäkämä konä ḥәywätu lä-qәddus Yoḥannәs Mäṭmәq wä-ʾәfo konä mәträtä rәʾәsu, Discourse by John Chrysostom on the life and decollation of John the Baptist / Homily by John Chrysostom on the glory of John the Baptist / Täʾamrä Yoḥannǝs Mäṭmǝq “Miracles of John the Baptist” / Mälkәʾa Yoḥannәs Mäṭmәq “Image of John the Baptist”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Nägär bäkämä konä ḥәywätu lä-qәddus Yoḥannәs Mäṭmәq wä-ʾәfo konä mәträtä rәʾәsu, Discourse by John Chrysostom on the life and decollation of John the Baptist (fols. 3ra – 30rb, l.11) II) Homily by John Chrysostom on the glory of John the Baptist (fols. 30rb, l.12 – 41vb, l.9) III) Täʾamrä Yoḥannǝs Mäṭmǝq “Miracles of John the Baptist”: 6 miracles (42ra – 50rb, l.13) IV) Mälkәʾa Yoḥannәs Mäṭmәq “Image of John the Baptist”: 27 strophes (50rb, l.15 – 54ra, l.8).

copyists.copyist: The concluding supplication formula (fol. 54ra) mentions ʾabunä Gäbrä Krәstos as the scribe (different from the scribe of QSM-023 and FBM-001).

donors.donor: Probably Wälättä Ṣadәqan and Wälättä Kidan mentioned in the concluding supplication formula (fol. 54ra).

txstates.txstate: Stains on fols. 6v, 7r, 11v-13v, 14rb, 29v-38r, 51v-52ra. Many leaves are affected by humidity.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – ፩I(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 3r-11v) – ፪II(9; s.l.: 3, stub after 7/fols. 12r-20v) – ፫III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – ፭V(7; s.l. 5, stub after 2/fols. 37r-43v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 44r-51v) – ፯VII(3; s.l.: 2, stub after 2/fols. 52r-54v) – B(2/fols. 55r-56v).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 17r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ሰላ᎓ for ሰላም᎓ on fols. 50va, l.16; 50vb, l.8; 51ra, ls. 1, 10; 51rb, ls. 1, 10; 51va, ls. 2, 11; 52ra, ls. 4, 11; 52rb, ls. 1, 10; 52va, ls. 2, 10; 52vb, ls. 1, 9, 17; 53ra, ls. 6-7, 13-14; 53rb, ls. 5, 13; 53va, ls. 6, 15; 53vb, l.7. ዮሐ፡ for ዮሐንስ፡ on fols. 52vb, ls. 5, 13; 53ra, ls. 3, 10; 53va, l.1; 53vb, l.2. ዮሐን፡ for ዮሐንስ፡ on fols. 53rb, ls. 1, 10, 53va, l.10.

desccontent.text: Discourse on the life and on the decollation of John the Baptist, ascribed to John Chrysostom (Nägär bäkämä konä ḥәywätu lä-qәddusYoḥannәs Mäṭmәq ... )
desccontent.mss: EMML no. 1344 (18th cent.), fols. 1r-35r: “Acts of John the Baptist by John Chrysostom” (EMML IV, 384; Institute of Ethiopian Studies, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1479 (1459/1460), fols. 2r-7r: “Acts of John the Baptist as told by John Chrysostom” (EMML IV, 593; Monastery of ʾabba Säyfä Mikaʾel, Ṣaʿda ʾƎmba Śәllasse, Kärän, Eritrea). EMML no. 4166 (1875), fols. 47v-65r: “Life (and martyrdom) of John the Baptist, by John Chrysostom” (EMML X, 59-60; Church of Safğ Yoḥannәs, ʾAngoläla, Shoa). Eth.Windsor II (17th cent.), fols. 56r-104r in “Discourse of John Chrysostom in praise of St. John the Baptist” (UllEthWin 74-75). Orient. 717 (18th cent.), fols. 2r-14r: “The Acts of S. John the Babtist, a discourse ascribed to John Chrysostom” (WrBriMus 192-193, no. 293).
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 3ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. This (is) the discourse on the life of St. John the Baptist and how the decapitation of his head happened. And St. John Chrysostom interpreted it, the patriarch (and) head of the bishops, meaning - in the country of Constantinople …
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 30rb, l.1: ... and when ˀabba Marqos was bishop and the martyrs placed their body together(??) May the Lord have compassion of us, of all of us, people of Christ, and even of his scribe, sinner and poor. And for his year... Forever and ever. Amen.

desccontent.text: Homily on the glory of John the Baptist, ascribed to John Chrysostom (Dәrsan zä-däräsä Yoḥannәs ʿAfä Wärq … bäʾәntä kәbru lä-Yoḥannәs Mäṭmәq)
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 30rb, l.12: In the name of the Father and Son and Holy Spirit. This (is) one homily which the priest John Chrysostom, patriarch of Constantinople, composed on the glory of John the Baptist …
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 41va, l.13:  ...and may his blessing be with the souls of his servants ... and with his maids ... forever  and ever. Amen. And save also his scribe from the temptation of the body and the spirit.

desccontent.text: Täʾamrä Yoḥannәs Mäṭmәq “Miracles of John the Baptist”
desccontent.mss: EMML no. 1656 (19th cent.), fols. 34v-36r: “Two miracles of John the Baptist” (EMML V, 141; Church of Dämṭa Giyotgis, Gubalafto, Wällo).
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 42ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. We start, with the help of the Lord, the writing of his Miracles: the star of the monastery Yordanos, and lamp of Ḍenon, close to …, the light of the wide world. From the man of the illicit ceremony, which he banished, to the power of the terrible concupiscence. …
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 50rb, l.3: ... and in that moment he dropped him in a big precipice and he died, he died badly. And this miracle was revealed in all the regions. May his prayer and his blessing be [with] his maid Wälättä Ṣadqan. Forever and ever. Amen.

desccontent.text: Mälkәʾa Yoḥannәs Mäṭmәq “Image of John the Baptist”

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 50rb, l.15: In the name of the Lord, the fire burned in the field of the understanding and in the name of the virgin Mary, John, teacher of the ignorant world, lamp of light, persecuting the darkness of sin...
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 53vb, l.16: ... from the hand of one nun two thin cakes. And to your maid Wälättä Kidan, save her from the temptation of the body and the spirit; for your sinner servant, its scribe, ˀabunä Gäbrä Krәstos, it was completed in the peace of the Lord Father. Amen.
